channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Bin left on pavement, 2nd October
item.description:
Residents not putting their bins back after being emptied

Overflowing non collected bins and furniture flytipping

item.title: Bagged waist outside of number 20 Blenheim Terrace, 2nd October
item.description:
Someone left two bags of waist outside of number 20 Blenheim Terrace outside of normal collection hours. Can you please collect it and investigate? Thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 20, Blenheim Terrace, St. John's Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 Broken Lights on Riverton Close, 2nd October
item.description:
Two broken lights in Riverton Close: - The street lamp post near the steps leading to numbers 14–30 Riverton Close. - The wall-mounted lamp above the same steps. Both lights have been out for some time, leaving that corner and the adjacent section of the car park completely dark at night. This creates a serious safety hazard for residents using the steps and parking area. The lack of lighting also makes the area more susceptible to criminal activity.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Riverton Close, Maida Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish overflow, 2nd October
item.description:
Continuous rubbish overflowing and strewn across the street. Tenants left last week and landlord/owner has not removed rubbish. Increase of foxes attacking dustbins.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rutherglen Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Near postbox, 2nd October
item.description:
I have only just noticed that this street light is not working

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Agar Grove, Kentish Town, London

item.title: Low hanging branches outside 87 Bromley rd, 2nd October

item.title: Greggs clearly haven't swept up outside, 2nd October
item.description:
They have left all rubbish

item.title: Empty dog poo bin alscot way, 2nd October
item.description:
Please empty the dog poo bin that is next to the playground on Alscot Way as it is quite full. Thank you!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Alscot Way, Old Kent Road, London

item.title: Water leaking under pavement, 2nd October
item.description:
Water appears to be leaking under the pavement. It has been going on months. But the paving stones are now unstable and dangerous.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pines Road, Bickley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The dog fouling is back, 2nd October
item.description:
I reported dog fouling a few months back several times and afterward, it seemed to markedly improve…for a time. Now the problem is back and it’s worse than ever. You can’t walk 10 steps without needing to dodge (if you’re lucky) dog poop all over the pavement. It’s absolutely terrible and very unsanitary as well. Something needs to be done about this. Please help!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Combedale Road, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Urine in communal stairwell, 2nd October
item.description:
Our communal stairwell has been used as a toilet again and needs thorough cleaning and disinfecting, please. The areas affected are the ground and first floors of the far north - eastern stairwell in Fearnley House.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Vestry Road, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping by same man, 2nd October
item.description:
Still the same thing. As a council it is your duty to clean this immediately.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mare Street, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Same fly tipping/ rubbish as always, 2nd October
item.description:
Hackney Council, This is a health and safety concern. Please stop allowing this. Will raise with Ombudsman soon as this is persistent and has been called a public health concern by your own employees

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mare Street, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: On west side of Kingsgate road, on north side of Gascony, 2nd October
item.description:
Completely blocked drain very near Kingsgate Road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 74, Kingsgate Road, Kilburn, London

item.title: Street lights on Wimborne Avenue and Berns Way connecting to Wimborne Avenue not working, currently time is 20.00 and not switched on. With the roads in darkness, making it unsafe to walk on the roads without a torch., 2nd October
item.description:
Both roads are in complete darkness at 20.00, making me feel unsafe walking home from work and having to carry a torch. Only light that is being provided is from the houses on the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Ravensbury Road, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Council's own rubbish left on Tuscan Road, 2nd October
item.description:
After a sweep of the street, bags of leaves were left in the street. They've been here for a week now. Inevitably, people are now adding their own rubbish. Disgusting.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tuscan Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish piling up on Badgemore Path, 2nd October
item.description:
A huge bag of rubbish has been here for over a week no (reported in the day it was dumped). Inevitably, other people are now adding their rubbish and it looks like a dump, with rotting food strewn across the pavement. Disgusting.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Badgemore Path, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Steep hill from hawkwood mount and from the otherside rhat leads onto Holmbury View, 2nd October
item.description:
Stationery parked vehicles are continuously crashed into from cars speeding down the steep hills to either side of Holmbury View, leading to cars being written off. It is only a matter of time before someone is hit. Something needs to be done ASAP!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Holmbury View, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: White hazardous substance, 2nd October
item.description:
Possibly paint has been poured and left on the side of the road. It could be hazardous and must be dealt with professionally.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Drive, Beckenham, London
